      • readJSONObjectFromFile

        public static org.json.JSONObject readJSONObjectFromFile(java.io.File file)
                                                  throws java.io.IOException,
                                                         org.json.JSONException
        A generic solution to read a JSONObject from a file. See readStringFromFile(File) for more details.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file is empty, or another IOException occurs
        org.json.JSONException - if the file could not be converted to a JSONObject.

      • readStringFromFile

        public static String readStringFromFile(java.io.File file)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        A generic solution to read from a file. For more details, see readStringFromInputStreamAndCloseStream(InputStream, int). This method loads the entire file into memory so will have the expected performance impact. If you're trying to read a large file, you should be handling your own reading to avoid out-of-memory errors.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readStringFromInputStreamAndCloseStream

        public static String readStringFromInputStreamAndCloseStream(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                                                             int bufferSize)
                                                      throws java.io.IOException
        A generic solution to read from an input stream in UTF-8. This function will read from the stream until it is finished and close the stream - this is necessary to close the wrapping resources. For a higher-level method, see readStringFromFile(File). Since this is generic, it may not be the most performant for your use case.
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - Size of the underlying buffer for read optimizations - must be > 0.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeJSONObjectToFile

        public static void writeJSONObjectToFile(java.io.File file,
                                         org.json.JSONObject obj)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        A generic solution to write a JSONObject to a file. See writeStringToFile(File, String) for more details.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeStringToFile

        public static void writeStringToFile(java.io.File file,
                                     String str)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        A generic solution to write to a File - the given file will be overwritten. If it does not exist yet, it will be created. See writeStringToOutputStreamAndCloseStream(OutputStream, String) for more details.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeStringToOutputStreamAndCloseStream

        public static void writeStringToOutputStreamAndCloseStream(java.io.OutputStream outputStream,
                                                           String str)
                                                    throws java.io.IOException
        A generic solution to write to an output stream in UTF-8. The stream will be closed at the completion of this method - it's necessary in order to close the wrapping resources. For a higher-level method, see writeStringToFile(File, String). Since this is generic, it may not be the most performant for your use case.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createTempDir

                                         String prefix)
